intro: Margyricarpus patagonicus, commonly known as the Patagonian sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the dry, sandy soils of southern South America. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. Margyricarpus patagonicus is adapted to survive in harsh, nutrient-poor environments, making it an important component of the region's flora.
